alert.note: Alert for Mora; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 01 at 5:11PM MDT until July 01 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Hermits Peak Calf Canyon burn scar in... South Central Mora County in northeastern New Mexico... Northwestern San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 715 PM MDT. * At 511 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar had diminished but light to briefly moderate rain will continue. Between 1.0 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.10 to 0.50 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing and will continue into the early evening. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact the Manuelitas Creek and Rio San Jose drainages as well as Rito Colorado, Deer Creek, Rito Chavez and Porvenir Canyon. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... El Porvenir, Tierra Monte, Sapello, Montezuma, San Ignacio, Rociada, Gallinas and Manuelitas. This includes the following recreation areas... E.V. Long Campground and El Porvenir Campground. This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 9. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 276 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 7 and 20. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 4 and 14. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
